Hi 

We just released a new product under LGPL.. maybe it could interest y=
ou..

Description: JunitScenario is an automation framework on top of JUnit=

to perform functional tests and stressing tests.
JUnitScenario is a tool t=
o simulate real life usage of applications.
It allows you to describe scena=
rios that are composed of unit tests
calls and simulate several users follo=
wing those scenarios.

For example, this scenario.xml file defines the cash=
ier scenario:

 <scenario name=3D"cashier" users=3D"20" loops=3D"500">
  <t=
ask JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTest"
JUnitMethod=3D"testCreateAccount"=
 wait=3D"10"/>
  <task JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTest"
JUnitMethod=3D=
"testDipositMoney" wait=3D"10"/>
  <task JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTe=
st"
JUnitMethod=3D"testWithdrawMoney" wait=3D"50"/>
</scenario>

The goal i=
s to have a very easy way to use your unit tests to test
your application s=
cability.

This document describes how to setup the example:
http://junitsc=
enario.sourceforge.net/?action=3Dexample

Visit JUnitScenario homepage at h=
ttp://junitscenario.sourceforge.net/

This release is just a first shot; we=
 are planning to refactor it,
develop an eclipse plug-in to easily build sc=
enarios, store tests in a
database for statistics.

--
St=E9phane TRAUMAT
